Description: Black-topped brown ware bowl, made of very fine Nile silt clay, with rounded base and vertical sides. The exterior has been well burnished, the black interior is streak burnished with perpendicular strokes.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Badari, el-, Grave or pit 5459
Curator's comments: One of five pots found in a heap, inverted on top of a mat, within a hole in cemetery 5700. See Burnton and Caton-thompson 1928: p. 13.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 13, pl. xii. BB12F)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
